creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: landscape scene with snowy mountains in background, rolling hills and silhouettes of trees in middle ground; small farmhouse and trees tucked in hills in foreground
inscription: left: 昭和四年作　白馬槍岳 {Shōwa yonen saku, Hakuba yaridake} | bottom: {Hakubayari}, in pencil: Hakuba yari | Yoshida Hiroshi
markings: LLC, embossed artist\'s baren seal and embossed artist\'s I seal: 博 {Hiroshi} | LRC, red artist\'s seal I: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Hakuba and Yarigadake
